bestBHT.bht: Why is it that you, the recognized guides in matters of God, do not know where this man is from when he has opened my eyes? This is a marvelous thing, a remarkable fact that you, with all your knowledge, fail to recognize the power behind the miracle. It is indeed strange and unaccountable that highly educated individuals like yourselves cannot see that this man must be from God. This undeniable truth stands: a man who has performed such a remarkable miracle must be sent by God.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and yet he hath opened mine eyes.
He had no need to say another word; but waxing bolder in defense of his Benefactor, and his views brightening by the very courage which it demanded.

Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us?"—thou, a base-born, uneducated, impudent youth, teach us, the trained, constituted, recognized guides of the people in the things of God! Out upon thee!
Albert Barnes: A marvelous thing - This is wonderful and amazing.
Know not from whence he is - That you cannot perceive that he who has performed such a miracle must be from God.
Marvin Vincent: The correct reading adds the article, the marvel.
Ye is emphatic: ye who might be expected to know about a man who has wrought such a miracle.
John Calvin: Certainly this is wonderful... it was highly improper that such a testimony of Divine power should be held in no estimation."
He magnifies the excellence of the miracle... none was ever heard to say that such a thing was done by a man."
He infers from this, that Christ was sent by God, because he is endued with so great power of the Spirit of God, to procure credit for himself and for his doctrine.
Archibald T. Robertson: Why, herein is the marvel... The man is angry now and quick in his insight and reply.
You confess your ignorance of whence he is, ye who know everything.
And yet he opened my eyes... That stubborn fact stands.
John Gill: Why herein is a marvellous thing; strange and unaccountable, that ye know not from whence he is.
That you learned doctors, men of sagacity and penetration, should not be able to discern that this man is of God.
And [yet] he hath opened mine eyes; which was so clearly and plainly the work of the Messiah, and to be done by him when he came.
John Wesley: Utterly illiterate as he was. And with what strength and clearness of reason!
So had God opened the eyes of his understanding, as well as his bodily eyes.
Why, herein is a marvellous thing, that ye should not know, that a man who has wrought a miracle, the like of which was never heard of before, must be from heaven, sent by God.

bhtAttempts.bht: Herein is a marvelous thing, that you know not from whence he is, and yet he has opened my eyes. He had no need to say another word; but waxing bolder in defense of his Benefactor, the man marvels at the ignorance of the leaders who failed to recognize and acknowledge the power behind the miracle. It is a strange and unaccountable thing that the learned doctors, men of sagacity and penetration, should not be able to discern that this man is of God. This stubborn fact stands: a man who has wrought such a miracle must be from heaven, sent by God.

Why is it that you, the recognized guides in matters of God, do not know where this man is from when he has opened my eyes? This is a marvelous thing, a remarkable fact that you, with all your knowledge, fail to recognize the power behind the miracle. It is indeed strange and unaccountable that highly educated individuals like yourselves cannot see that this man must be from God. This undeniable truth stands: a man who has performed such a remarkable miracle must be sent by God.

Why is it that you, the recognized guides in matters of God, do not know where this man is from when he has opened my eyes? This is a marvelous thing, a remarkable fact that you, with all your knowledge, fail to recognize the power behind the miracle. It is indeed strange and unaccountable that highly educated individuals like yourselves cannot see that this man must be from God. This undeniable truth stands: a man who has performed such a remarkable miracle must be sent by God.

Why is it that you, the recognized guides in matters of God, do not know where this man is from when he has opened my eyes? This is a marvelous thing, a remarkable fact that you, with all your knowledge, fail to recognize the power behind the miracle. It is indeed strange and unaccountable that highly educated individuals like yourselves cannot see that this man must be from God. This undeniable truth stands: a man who has performed such a remarkable miracle must be sent by God.

How astonishing it is that you, who claim to be knowledgeable, do not know where this man comes from, and yet he has opened my eyes. This is a marvelous thing, a remarkable and unaccountable fact, that those who should be able to perceive the power behind this miracle fail to do so. It is truly astounding that individuals like yourselves, with all your education, cannot recognize that this man must surely be from God. The undeniable reality remains: anyone who can perform such a wondrous miracle must be sent by God.
